evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc
Class HBinaryInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      java.io.FilterInputStream
          java.io.DataInputStream
              evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc.HBinaryInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.DataInput
public class HBinaryInputStream
extends java.io.DataInputStream

This subclass of DataInputStream supplies five extra functions. Each is the same as the the routine in DataInputStream that reads in a primitive numerical data types (short, int, long, float, or double), except that it will reverse the bytes if the environment variable HOSTOS says that this is a Linux machine. This is required because Java ALWAYS assumes big-endian! For examples of how this is used, see ESPData.

UPDATING A ROUTINE TO SWITCH FROM A DataInputStream TO A HBinaryInputStream:

First, you need to change all references to "DataInputStream" into "HBinaryInputStream". Next, all read commands for float, double, short, int, or long are changed to the corresponding *Swap routine in here. So readFloat becomes readFloatSwap, readInt becomes readIntSwap, etc.

Author:
hank

readByteArraySwap

public byte[] readByteArraySwap(int size)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Read in the appropriate byte array, swapping endians if necessary.

Parameters:
size - Number of bytes to read
Returns:
The byte array, swapped if needed.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if DataInputStream read throws an exception using this in constructor.

setEndianFlag

public void setEndianFlag(boolean flag)
Endian flag should be true if the file to read in requires swapping (i.e. is in little endian) or false otherwise. Static vars LITTLE_ENDIAN_DATA_FLAG and BIG_ENDIAN_DATA_FLAG can be used. Wrapper on setReverseBytesFlag.

Parameters:
flag - The new flag value.

setReverseBytesFlag

public void setReverseBytesFlag(boolean flag)
Sets the reverse bytes flag.

Parameters:
flag - The new flag value.
